title: Voice Timbre Attribute Detection 2025 Challenge Evaluation Plan
author: Zhengyan Sheng (NERC-SLIP, University of Science and Technology of China), Jinghao He (NERC-SLIP, University of Science and Technology of China), Liping Chen (NERC-SLIP, University of Science and Technology of China), Kong Aik Lee (Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, The Hong Kong Polytechnic University), Zhen-Hua Ling (NERC-SLIP, University of Science and Technology of China)
relevance_why: This paper outlines a challenge focusing on voice timbre attributes, which aligns closely with Dr. Liu's interest in audio-generation, voice manipulation, and speaker recognition, making it relevant for collaborative developments in these areas.
background: The challenge evaluates if two voices differ significantly in a specified timbre descriptor, providing a framework to understand human perceptions of voice qualities.
contribution: The paper introduces the Voice Timbre Attribute Detection challenge to solve voice attribute comparison, enhancing understanding of voice characteristics through specified descriptors.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing systems often focus on direct voice recognition or attribute labeling but do not quantify comparative voice qualities.
technical_comparison.novelty: This challenge shifts the emphasis to quantifiable differences in timbre attributes, facilitating more granular analyses of voice characteristics.

key_innovation: The challenge approach of comparing voice pairs based on subjective timbre characteristics provides new insights for developing explainable audio technologies.
real_world_impact: This initiative can lead to advancements in automated voice recognition systems, helping improve applications in communication tools, entertainment, and accessibility.
limitations: No significant limitations are mentioned; however, the challenge might be limited to the speakers included in the dataset.

new_terms.timbre: **Timbre** refers to the characteristic quality or color of a sound that distinguishes different types of sound production, such as voices or musical instruments.

open_sourcing: The challenge framework and baseline methods are available on GitHub at https://github.com/vTAD2025-Challenge/vTAD
